title: Ignite and Electrocute Together is BS
body:
"The problem is electrocute and ignite.
At lvl 6:
Ignite does 205 damage.
Electrocute does 110 damage.

That’s 315 damage, nearly 40% of a champion’s max hp at lvl 6.

How is this shit allowed? 40% of my hp gone to things that aren’t even enemy champion abilities.

I should make a thread about this."

EDIT: this doesn't even factor in minor runes and bonus stats given by domination.

The purpose of ignite is to be an execution

but the reason why they made it a DoT was to make it so that you can't just have like 5 people walk up to you and ignite you 5 times instantly for massive damage.

In theory they could give it a special clause like Summoner Heal to make it less effective when used in rapid succession but I believe that having it be a DoT means you can never insta-die 100-0 from ignite stacking (whereas even with that heal reduction, you could still send a guy up 1000 hit points if 5 heals went through).
ignite doesn't stack, a new ignite refreshes the ticks.

Thats the point he means about it being a DoT.
If it was just instant dmg they could theoretically stack.
It's supposed to finish people off.

this is still relevant..problem hasn't gone anywhere just because this thread did
Legends say there is a summoner spell called CLEANSE

Cleanse is pointless against ignite in most situations. Like yes, Ahri just ignited me, but would I rather cleanse the ignite or save it for her charm (which will do much more damage when you factor in other abilities during the CC)? Yes, Cleanse does get rid of Ignite, but with Cleanse down, you're always on the back foot against champs that have CC as well as ignite, and you basically only have one summoner spell against champs without CC since your cleanse is only to counter their ignite.
Most people on these boards probably don't even realize that Cleanse will get rid of Ignite, Exhaust as well.
Doesn't even factor in champion abilities.

Well, summoner spells are at every player's disposal. You can be ignited, but you can cleanse out of it, essentially taking only 1 tick of that damage, which would be equal to one autoattack, so not as much damage. You can also take Barrier and survive an all-in in that way. 

There are also defensive runes that counter the power of Electrocute. For example, Bone Plating is a strong direct counter to Electrocute. Second Wind is also a very strong rune for the early game as well.

If you find yourself in situations where the amount of damage you take by Ignite and Electrocute can be lethal or force you out of lane, then you might as well opt yourself for a more defensive approach.

Generally, there are ways to counter most things in the game, and those two are indeed counterable.
